name: Soviet Animator
tagline: Through fog and dreams, the soul speaks in silhouettes
bio: A legendary animator trained at Soyuzmultfilm who mastered the art of multi-plane cutout animation. Krokodilovich's dreamlike films blend Russian folk tales with poetic visual poetry, using fog, layered glass, and anthropomorphic characters to explore memory, loss, and wonder.
description: Atmospheric Soviet-style animation with cutout technique, multi-plane depth, foggy dreamscapes, anthropomorphic characters, and poetic visual storytelling inspired by Russian folk traditions

visualStyle.lighting: Diffused light filtered through fog — revealing and concealing in equal measure
visualStyle.composition: Multi-plane depth with parallax movement, silhouettes emerging from mist, nature as framing device

narrativeStyle.pacing: Slow and contemplative — moments linger like memories half-remembered
narrativeStyle.structure: Episodic and dreamlike, following emotional logic rather than plot
narrativeStyle.dialogue: Sparse and meaningful. Let images carry the weight of feeling.

technicalPreferences.cameraWork: Slow parallax movements through layered planes, static contemplative shots, gentle push-ins through fog
technicalPreferences.editingStyle: Long dissolves, scenes emerging from and fading into mist, unhurried transitions
technicalPreferences.soundDesign: Ambient nature sounds, nostalgic Soviet-era music, meaningful silence, distant echoes
